page.title: 07 LOCAL HISTORY PART 3
page.content: ...parking close to the well, a kerbed island was created to protect it. And, ironically, on the night before the accident happened a member of the county council's highways staff had thought about erecting a safety post near it. The tractor was turning on to the road from a track behind the well when the loaded trailer hit it. Parish council chairman Mr. Ian Arrol commented: "It is very regrettable because it was a very interesting building. The future of the well will be discussed at the next council meeting on September 8th." The well is thought to have been constructed in 1724 by Col. William Boyle, of Holmwood, to replace the pond at Little Green adjoining Jemmatt's Farm which had until then supplied the locality with water. The roundhouse...
